question_text: To act in the best interest of the patient is an example of which ethical principle?

options.A: Justice

question_text: What is the definition of euthanasia?

options.A: Physician helps the patient with medication to end his life.
options.B: Patient refuses life-sustaining treatment leading to death.
options.C: Administration of pain relief that may unintentionally shorten life.
options.D: Withdrawal of artificial nutrition and hydration to allow natural death.

options.A: Do it alone
options.D: Ask a more experienced colleague for help

question_text: Which enzyme is the rate-limiting step in catecholamine synthesis?

options.A: Phenylalanine Hydroxylase

question_text: What is the definition of euthanasia?

options.A: A doctor prescribes or administers a drug to end the patient’s life
options.B: The physician provides the means by which the patient can end his life
options.C: The patient refuses life-sustaining treatment leading to death
options.D: The use of high doses of painkillers that may hasten death

options.A: A doctor prescribes or administers a drug to end the patient's life.
options.B: The physician provides the means by which the patient can end his life.
options.C: The patient decides to stop treatment.
options.D: The family decides to withdraw life support.

question_text: You have a language barrier with an ER staff member. What is the best way to communicate?

options.A: Situation, background, assessment, and recommendation
options.B: Pay extra attention to facial gestures
options.C: Say your order clearly and ask questions to ensure understanding
options.D: Use simple words and speak slowly

question_text: In regards to patient safety and preventing medical errors, which research methodology is the best?

options.A: Case reports

question_text: According to resource allocation, when building a children's hospital, which statement regarding the location is correct?

options.A: In an area with low cost
options.B: In an area with a large population
options.C: In an area with a large number of children
options.D: In a population interested in the healthcare system

question_text: What is the definition of informed consent?

options.A: Explain to the patient the purpose of the study
options.B: Obtain written permission from the patient before any procedure
options.C: Provide the patient with all possible treatment options
options.D: Ensure the patient understands the risks and benefits of the procedure
